department.ch: 認知神經科學研究所碩士班

goal.en: "This course is designed to provide a broad introduction to event-related brain potential (ERP) studies in cognition. Issues covered in this course include (1) the genesis of electroencephalography (EEG) and magnetoencephalography (MEG), (2) the recording of EEG/ERP, (3) design and analysis of ERP experiments, (4) ERP studies of human cognition. Students will also get hand-on experience by designing and conducting ERP experiments in their own projects. Each week we will focus on one specific discussion topic, which is associated with a set of assigned readings. In the class there will be a general introduction for each topic followed by the reports of the readings assigned to you. The readings should be completed before the class. Assignments will be given when necessary, and you should complete them before due dates. You will design and conduct an ERP experiment. The paradigm of the experiment will be discussed and decided by you and the instructor. There will be a project presentation in the last class.
